subject: Re: kerning
msgSnippet: ... the ... part ... Yeah, I never really liked that either.  I will change it. ... Well, I did that in a fair number of places: sort of spooned
messageBody:
> I hate to be a Johnny one-note, but am I the only person bothered by
the
> altered form of "eat" in Kingsley? Is there some reason the second
part
> of the letter cannot be vertical as it is in the manual? I find it too
> similar to "ooze."

Yeah, I never really liked that either. I will change it.

> > Note the improved kerning in 'you' and 'rather' in the first
> > sentence. Do you think I went overboard with 'culture' in the last
> > sentence?
> >
> The "l" appears too close to the vowel to my eyes.

Well, I did that in a fair number of places: sort of "spooned"
complimentary characters. What do you think of "that" (They-At-Tea)
earlier in the paragraph?

> I also noted that "belongs" is misspelled. It contains a "t" that
> should not be there. A few words later, the word "craftwork" is also
> mispelled to my ears - ("on" vowel after "r").

fixed both: I had mistyped craftwork: not used to my QS keyboard
layout yet.

> > Using this method, it may be possible to make an almost-senior
version
> > of the same font. In fact, if I can figure out the 'alternate
glyphs'
> > thing then I might be able to shoehorn half characters in as well.
> >
> That would be "fantabulous" as Eddie Izzard would say.

erg, tried to understand the (dense) manual on this topic earlier
today: no luck yet. moreover, I can't get the bloody font to work on
Windows (or Firefox on the mac). so frustrating.

oliver
